article.headline: Fordham 80, Northeastern 59
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Michael Haynes scored 17 of his 25 points in the second half Sunday to help give Fordham a 80-59 victory over Northeastern. The game had been postponed because of snow. Jermaine Anderson followed with 13 points and eight assists for the Rams (2-3), who held a 36-35 edge at halftime. Drew Williamson had 11 points. Mark Jarrell-Wright contributed 11 points and 10 assists for Fordham while John Blackgrove added 10 points. Marcus Barnes, with 21 points, was the only double-figure scorer for the Huskies (3-3). After Northeastern gained a 47-47 tie on Sylbrin Robinson's layup at 14:34 of the second half, the Rams broke the game open with a 23-3 run for a 70-50 advantage at 5:57. Haynes collected eight points during the surge and Anderson had five.
